title: Large-Scale Design and Operational Strategies for UDL-Based Concurrent Enrollment Programs

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of foundational instructional design principles and Universal Design for Learning (UDL) concepts
context.additional_context: Aims to provide inquiry-based lesson design experience applying UDL principles under a university-high school collaboration system. Operates through a blended model of online platforms and face-to-face sessions

learning_goals: Participants can design a lesson plan using the UDL (Universal Design for Learning) framework.
Participants can develop a blended learning model applying inquiry-based instructional methods.
Participants can plan an inclusive educational environment through analysis of diverse learner needs.
Participants can identify at least three educational obstacles occurring in concurrent enrollment programs and propose solutions.

resources: UDL (Universal Design for Learning) Guidelines Document

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
